Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. Create a new face in the sketch, and then create a loop (loop_1) on this face. 4. Add four lines to loop_1. - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.05, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.05, 0.0], End Point [0.05, 0.25] - line_3: Start Point [0.05, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.25] - line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 5. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.25. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system: euler_angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0], translation_vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.75 units towards the normal direction, and 0 units in the opposite direction, resulting in a new solid body. Part 2: A Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. The dimensions of the object are as follows: length 0.05 units, width 0.025 units (diameter), and height 0.025 units. 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0], and translation vector [0.05, 0.1125, 0.3625]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. Create a new face in the sketch and then create a loop (loop_1) on this face. 4. Add a circle (circle_1) to loop_1. - Circle Center: [0.0125, 0.0125], Radius: 0.0125 5. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.025. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system: euler\\_angles [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0], translation\\_vector [0.05, 0.1125, 0.3625]. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0 units towards the normal direction and 0.05 units in the opposite direction. Perform the CutFeatureOperation for the current part against the previous part.</description>

</json>
